node.title: He Had Him at ‘Howdy’
node.alt: Will Jardell, left, and James Wallington.
node.description: Will Jardell and James Wallington met in 2014 during auditions for “America’s Next Top Model.” Four years later, both competed on “Amazing Race,” and won.
node.content: ["Just three words had passed between Will Jardell and James Wallington when each said they knew they had found the \u201cone.\u201d", "The two met in February 2014 at the Millennium Biltmore Hotel in Los Angeles during auditions for the reality TV show \u201cAmerica\u2019s Next Top Model.\u201d Mr. Wallington was a casting assistant, Mr. Jardell, an aspiring model.", "\u201cHowdy,\u201d said Mr. Jardell, who is 31 and a native Texan, upon passing Mr. Wallington, 32, in a hallway. \u201cFind me.\u201d", "Mr. Wallington said, \u201cWill had me at \u2018howdy.\u2019 My heart just fell out of me.\u201d", "Having been selected for the modeling competition, Mr. Jardell faced two months of filming during which he would be sequestered and unable to use his phone. It ended up that he, ultimately, was the one who did the finding.", "After rising to a runner-up in the competition and returning to his hometown Nederland, Texas, he tracked down Mr. Wallington on social media. And soon after the two began a text and phone relationship.", "\u201cIt really was love at first sight,\u201d said Mr. Wallington, who just after the initial \u201chowdy\u201d had announced to his family in Grand Rapids, Mich., that he had found his future husband.", "In September 2014, Mr. Jardell, who was modeling and teaching dance, moved to Los Angeles, where he attended the University of Southern California and received a master\u2019s degree in public health. He is now a program specialist at the University of Southern California\u2019s Institute on Inequalities in Global Health. Mr. Wallington continues to work as an independent casting associate producer. The couple also contribute travel related content to the magazine OUT Traveler.", "In 2018, Mr. Wallington and Mr. Jardell landed a slot to compete in the \u201cAmazing Race\u201d reality TV show. This was a childhood dream of Mr. Wallington, who had auditioned many times with friends and family members.", "[Click here to binge read this week\u2019s featured couples.]", "To prepare for the 21-day challenge, the couple ran miles toting heavy packs, learned the flags of the world\u2019s countries and memorized key phrases in seven languages. Countless hours were spent poring over every episode of every previous season of the series \u2014 sometimes multiple times.", "During the competition, which took place from Nov. 9 to Dec. 3, 2018, the couple navigated challenges in 11 countries, including Colombia and Kazakhstan, beating 11 teams to claim the $1 million prize money. At the finish line in New Orleans, Mr. Jardell proposed marriage to a surprised and exhausted Mr. Wallington. Four million television viewers watched the couple seal their win, and their commitment, with a kiss.", "For Mr. Jardell, it was a public display of affection unimaginable to him as a child growing up in a deeply religious home in a small Texas town. \u201cI never imagined the possibility of marrying a man,\u201d he said. \u201cI literally tried to pray the gay away. Seeing a couple like us on TV would have helped me so, so much.\u201d", "On Dec. 3, three years after their \u201cAmazing Race\u201d victory, the couple returned to New Orleans to marry at the New Orleans Athletic Club. Two hundred guests attended, including 20 \u201cAmazing Race\u201d competitors, one of whom, Kellie Wells-Brinkley, a Universal Life minister and former Olympic track and field champion, officiated. Guests were required to be vaccinated or provide a recent negative Covid test.", "In a nod to their \u201cAmazing Race\u201d team brand, the grooms donned purple bow ties.", "During the sunset ceremony the couple\u2019s wedding bands were passed among the guests. \u201cThinking about the blessings our friends put on our rings will help us in our future, both through the good times and the bad,\u201d Mr. Wallington said.", "Once married, the couple celebrated with a parade through the French Quarter accompanied by the Kinfolk Brass Band and dancing guests. Residents emerged from their homes to cheer and clap as the procession snaked back to the wedding venue where they enjoyed an internationally themed dinner.", "\u201cI never knew I could feel so much gratitude and love in a single day,\u201d said Mr. Jardell."]
